technology.name: Cold Storage
technology.description: In the Endless Steppes, nothing will grow in the grip of winter, so preserving food for the long haul is not just practical, but essential.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +2%
Growth: +10

technology.name: Hooked Axe Blades
technology.description: This ingenious design not only enables efficient deflection of blows, but can also be hooked around an opponent's shield or haul a rider from their mount.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars and Streltsi units

technology.name: Leather Treatment
technology.description: Hides and skins are tanned to protect and make them more durable in the harsh, northern conditions.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Horse Archers and Kossovite Dervishes units

technology.name: Ice Sculpting
technology.description: An important skill for acolytes of the Ice Court is learning to carve and shape its abundance through manipulation of the highly-volatile Ice Magic.

effects.description: Unlocks an Ice Court training slot for Frost Maiden Heroes
Hero capacity: +1 for Frost Maidens

technology.name: Ice Court Indoctrination
technology.description: Candidates for membership of the Ice Court must be sought and instructed in its myriad customs and rites if the next generation of Ice Maidens and Witches is to rise.

effects.description: Unlocks an Ice Court training slot for Ice Witch Lords
Recruit rank: +1 for Kislev units
Control: +1

technology.name: Ice Cade Collars
technology.description: These intricate designs are woven from strips cut from the pelts of young beasts, perhaps slain for the tenderness of their meat.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% for Snow Leopard units

technology.name: Convalescence
technology.description: Time dedicated purely to rest, but also knowledge of healing herbs and the methods needed to extract the best from them, are key to a casualty's survival.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +3%
Growth: +5

technology.name: Ice Court Discipline
technology.description: Candidates for membership of the Ice Court must be sought among the young of Erengrad and indoctrinated into its myriad customs and rites.

effects.description: Unlocks an Ice Court training slot for Frost Maiden Heroes
Hero capacity: +1 for Frost Maidens

technology.name: Pirate’s Weapons
technology.description: The Old World's second-largest trading port provides safe berthing to pirates and privateers in return for knowledge of foreign martial advances.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Kislev units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +2 for Kislev units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Kislev units

technology.name: Lens Crafters
technology.description: It takes complex machinery, the keenest eye and considerable skill to fashion lenses good enough for use in high-grade telescopes and spy-glasses.

effects.description:
Campaign line of sight: +10%
	(all characters)

technology.name: Ice Court Control
technology.description: Candidates for membership of the Ice Court must be sought and instructed in its myriad customs and rites if the next generation of Ice Maidens and Witches is to rise.

effects.description: Unlocks an Ice Court training slot for Ice Witch Lords
Recruit rank: +1 for Kislev units
Control: +1

technology.name: Glacial Prism
technology.description: The Ice Witches, by use of their most-dangerous magic, can construct great geometries to range and direct their devastating magical attacks.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +15% when increasing
	(all armies)
Ammunition: +10% for Ice Guard

technology.name: Improved Lookouts
technology.description: Better telescopic aids provided by Astromancers of the Empire allow those stationed in Praag’s northern watchtowers to issue an earlier warning should Chaos invaders return.

effects.description:
Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Capital Barrack Renovations
technology.description: Renovating the vast abandoned wings of the Bokha Palace will provide additional accommodation to barrack many rotas of loyal soldiers.

effects.description: Relief Columns commandment: additional -5% to recruitment cost

technology.name: Iron River Stone
technology.description: Stone quarried from the mineral-rich shores of the Iron River is of vastly superior quality, so supply must be kept constant if the city is to expand at pace.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for resource-producing buildings
Construction cost: -5% for all buildings

technology.name: Tzar Loyalty Rite
technology.description: It is only right that those who serve as the Tzar's bodyguard are proven loyal beyond doubt.

effects.description: Leadership: +8 for Tzar Guard units
Melee defence: +4 for Tzar Guard units

technology.name: Currency Exchanges
technology.description: The ability to exchange the differing coinage of the Old World’s many nations will give Erengrad an advantage over other port-cities.

effects.description: Awaken the Land commandment: additional 2% income

technology.name: Grom’s Telemetry
technology.description: There are many scientific intricacies that govern effective arms-craft; Little Grom can be adjusted and primed for maximum efficiency as well as devastation.

effects.description: Range: +15% for Little Grom units

technology.name: Norse Hatred
technology.description: Ever since they sacked Erengrad, levelling much of the city and slaughtering a large proportion of the populace, it's an understatement to say that the survivors have no love for the barbaric Norsemen.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Norsca
Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Norsca
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos and Daemons of Chaos

technology.name: Witch-Hunter Conclaves
technology.description: Praag’s Witch Hunters are as zealous as their Empire counter-parts due to the city’s troubled history. Additional assemblies will see more heretics rooted out.

effects.description: The Power of the Church commandment: additional -2 corruption reduction

technology.name: Call to Prayer
technology.description: The Cursed City is home to the Great Orthodoxy, whose Grand Patriarch leads the faithful from the path of madness and mutation.

effects.description: Hero action cost: -15% for Patriarchs

technology.name: Streltsi Arsenal
technology.description: Ever on a war footing lest the Dark Gods turn their Ruinous gaze upon Praag once more, the elite guard store many of their blackpowder rifles here, for the call to existential conflict may come at any moment.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Streltsi
Armour-piercing missile damage: +10% for Streltsi units

technology.name: Gospodar Governance
technology.description: It is thought the natural state of affairs that the more civilised southern tribe should rule over the simple peoples of the north.

effects.description: Construction cost: -25% for Hallowed Wood buildings

technology.name: Ursunite Cult Customs
technology.description: The ancient ways of the Old Religion are embedded and enmeshed within the lives of the ordinary Kislevites who toil the land.

effects.description: Upgrades Ursun invocation of The Motherland

technology.name: Festival of Urtza
technology.description: This gathering is an important date in the Ungol Calendar upon which the strength of the Bear God and the protection He gives the common folk of Kislev is celebrated city-wide.

effects.description: Upgrades Tor invocation of The Motherland

technology.name: Improved Empire Relations
technology.description: They may seem like soft southerners, unworthy of comradeship, but the Empire's vast resources – and therefore its friendship – are essential if Kislev is to guard the northern marches from Ruin.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Empire

technology.name: Gospodar Bloodline
technology.description: Proof that your line extends from the noble Gospodars gives a distinct advantage in every quarter of Kislevite life.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +2

technology.name: Salyak Cult Customs
technology.description: Worship of the Goddess of Healing and Comfort instils both common sense and nurturing care in the people of Erengrad, that they might look out for each other in the frozen, wintry wastes.

effects.description: Upgrades Salyak invocation of The Motherland

technology.name: Harbour Cartel
technology.description: The formidable league of port merchants exercise the real power over the great city's economic growth.

effects.description: Tradable resources produced: +5%

technology.name: Harbour Master’s Authority
technology.description: The harbour master is responsible for all aspects of customs and excise, right the way down to the tariffs and duties levied upon foreign traders.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +5%

technology.name: Dazh Cult Customs
technology.description: The God of Fire and Sun is as old as life itself, so His worship is as much a part of Kislevite life as breathing and eating.

effects.description: Upgrades Dazh invocation of The Motherland

technology.name: Praag Remembers
technology.description: "Lest we forget those who lost their minds and lives to the Dark Gods' terrible advance…"

effects.description:
Corruption: -2
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Praag Veterans
technology.description: These men, of ancient Ungol blood, are the hardened masters of war in the vast Oblasts.

effects.description: Attribute: Immune to Psychology when fighting against Warriors of Chaos and Daemons of Chaos

technology.name: Toughened Stanchions
technology.description: The added downforce provided by these upright wooden bracings makes for much sturdier sleds which are far less likely to overturn during swift manoeuvres on the ice.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for War Sleds units

technology.name: Troll Country Pathfinder
technology.description: Those who lose their way while traversing Troll Country tend to end up dead. Some men of Kislev have spent their lives learning all the safe routes through the region.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +5%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Orthodoxy Interdiction
technology.description: When the order comes down, there is no possible reason to avoid duty that would not be considered a dishonourable and shameful shirking of responsibility.

effects.description: Global recruitment capacity: +2

technology.name: Aggressive Cultivation
technology.description: Forming deep gorges to build up ice into great shards, or planting lots of iron-briars and sharp, thorny scrub, ensures the elemental guardians are created with bite.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 for Elemental Bear units

technology.name: Mesh Layers
technology.description: Several layers of finely-wrought, ultra-thin metal skin, bound together, provide the strength to withstand axe or hammer blows, and deflect arrow or spear points when launched acutely.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi and Ice Guard units

technology.name: Fortify the Land
technology.description: A fertile Motherland – fortified by crop rotation and lots of bear manure – will provide a replenished spirit should the elements be called to the nation’s defence.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +12% for Elemental Bear units

technology.name: Improved Harbour Defences
technology.description: The positioning of sizeable gabions allows for the swift construction and rearrangement of Erengrad's coastal defences, so gun emplacements and forts can be scaled up or down according to the level of threat faced.

effects.description:
Defensive supplies: +500 per turn when under siege
	(factionwide)

technology.name: Harbour Watch
technology.description: Give a man a spear and he may run; give him a spear, a gun, and some idea of how to use them and you have the beginnings of a useful, even professional, port patrol service.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for infantry and cavalry units

technology.name: Born in Praag
technology.description: A childhood spent in the Cursed City's cut-throat backstreets makes a man of someone years before they officially come of age.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +5%

technology.name: Gryphon Lodge Secrets
technology.description: Kislev's elite fighting force are the keepers of the specialist martial knowledge which sets them well apart from their nearest rivals.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% for Gryphon Legion units

technology.name: Siege Mentality
technology.description: A city that has withstood near-constant beleaguerment throughout its history produces citizens of a particular mindset – always ready to take up the life-or-death struggle once more.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 when under siege
Ammunition: +15% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi, Ice Guard and Horse Archer units
Reload time reduction: +10% when under siege

technology.name: Breechloaders
technology.description: It is certainly an advance, by virtue of being both faster and many magnitudes less dangerous, to load firearms at the opposite end to their muzzles.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +3 for Armoured Kossars and Streltsi units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Armoured Kossars and Streltsi units

technology.name: Dwarfen Anvils
technology.description: If you want the very best smithing equipment, there's only really one race to buy from; for the Dwarfs, such things are in their very blood.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kislev melee cavalry units

technology.name: Bear Baiting
technology.description: Angering the great beasts just enough to make them aggressive, but not so much that they kill you, is a valuable skill to master.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Frenzy" for War Bear Rider units

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

technology.name: Kislevian Ducat
technology.description: Men able to accumulate ducats are truly the major players among the city's burgeoning merchant class.

effects.description: Income from Settlement buildings: +20%

technology.name: Imperial Efficiency
technology.description: The Empire has developed many production processes to their optimal effectiveness, but security is lax, or at least insufficient to prevent enterprising Kislevites 'borrowing' the best of them…

effects.description: Income from all buildings: +5%

technology.name: The Erengrad Code
technology.description: The minutiae of these regulations ensure that Erengrad's port is run in the most efficient way possible.

effects.description: Income from Ports: +20%

technology.name: Arabyan Fire
technology.description: The secrets of chemistry learned in the distant East bring Little Grom's explosive anger to fiery, corporeal life.

effects.description: Enables flaming attacks for Little Grom units
Ammunition: +15% for War Sleds and Little Grom units

technology.name: Port Merchant’s Guild
technology.description: The Guild ensures that goods and money flow freely from the ports into the heart of the city, and the right people profit.

effects.description: Growth: +15

technology.name: Oblast Scavenger
technology.description: Survival in the barren, inhospitable Oblasts requires stamina and tenacity found in few other men.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%

technology.name: Ur-Stones
technology.description: Spirits of ancient and loyal War Bears are drawn to carved Ur-stones that are planted in the ground to power the elemental force that protects the Motherland.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Elemental Bear units

technology.name: Orthodoxy Blessed
technology.description: Banners warded with divine favour ensure that Kislev's warriors always have more than a fighting chance.

effects.description: Grants the Banner of the Orthodoxy banner to your faction
Recruitment cost: -5%
Recruit rank: +1 for Kislev units
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units

technology.name: Devotional Creed
technology.description: Ceremonies such as these are crucial when living so close to Chaos Wastes, lest the Ruinous Ones insidious corruption infect and disrupt the land.

effects.description: Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Devotion gained from fighting Chaos: +10%

technology.name: Ice Rites
technology.description: Special rites, taught by the Ice Witches, set an especially tough permafrost on the land – an armoured sheen for the elements.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 5% for Elemental Bears
Physical resistance: 10% for Elemental Bear units
